intro: Galphimia hirsuta f. virescens, commonly known as the green-hairy galphimia, is a variant of the Galphimia hirsuta species native to Mexico. It is a flowering plant in the family Fabaceae, characterized by its hairy stems and vibrant yellow flowers. The leaves are typically trifoliate, with three leaflets that are hairy on the upper surface. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for xeriscaping in arid regions. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting blooms and drought tolerance.
